h2.a: Woodbridge School District Feeding Times and Locations

div.div:
Dear Woodbridge Families,
The Woodbridge School District will continue to offer grab and go meals for students at various times and locations throughout the district.
Meals will be served on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Although we are limiting the number of days serving, you will still be provided meals for all seven days.
Please remember to adhere to proper social distancing guidelines when receiving your meals. If a line is forming, please remember to stand six feet away from the nearest family receiving meals.
Meals will be provided to all children 18 and under at no charge on a first come first serve basis at the sites and times as follows.
Call 211 for the most up to date locations and times.

Sincerely,
The Woodbridge School District
This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

h2.font: Woodbridge School District Coronavirus Preparedness Plan

br.br:
​​Dear Woodbridge Families:
Due to the increase in Coronavirus cases in neighboring states, I have made the decision to cancel all field trips for out-of-state destinations. The health and safety of our students and community is the main reason that I make this decision. We anticipate the numbers to continue to rise and believe that it is in our best interest to be overly cautious. Our staff will be working on reimbursing families for those trips for which you have already paid.
Included with this letter is a plan that the District will follow as the Coronavirus situation continues to develop. School district staff will remain in contact with the Delaware Department of Health and the Center for Disease Control. We will continue to follow the guidance that they have provided for schools. We recommend that you visit their websites for the most recent information to to www.dhss.delaware.gov/dhss and www.cdc.gov
We will continue to utilize our Facebook page and website to provide links to important Coronavirus information as it becomes available. We thank you for your patience and understanding as we navigate the upcoming weeks. We ask you to continue to stress to your students the importance of proper handwashing and please keep them home if they are sick.
Sincerely,
Heath B. Chasanov
Superintendent
Download your copy of the plan in english or spanish.

h2.a: Congratulations Mrs. Katie Sears, Delaware's Elementary School Counselor of the Year. We are so proud and honored to have you representing our district.

img.style: float: left; position: relative; left: 0px; top: 0px; margin: 0 15px 15px 0; border: 0;

div.style: float: left; text-align: left; position: relative;

div.br:
The Woodbridge School District is happy to announce the annual application process for the Mary H. Bailey Educational Trust Fund Scholarship. Eligible applicants are students who have graduated from Woodbridge High School, beginning with the Class of 1996 who have applied within five (5) years of graduation, and said eligibility shall be exhausted, at the sooner of either ten (10) years after graduation, or seven (7) years from time of their first application.
Beginning Monday, January 6, 2020 application packets are available and may be picked up at the District Office at 16359 Sussex Highway, Bridgeville, Delaware, or by requesting same by mail. Telephone requests may be made by calling (302) 337-7990 during regular working hours, 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. The application packet can also be requested via email by contacting Nina Colegrove at nina.colegrove@wsd.k12.de.us.
The completed application packet and supportive information must be received in a sealed envelope at the District Office by 4:00 p.m. on Thursday, February 27, 2020.

h2.a: Marching Band Photo: The WHS Marching Band’s Halftime performance gets creative by using bucket drumming in the form of percussion. Color guard member Alex Nechay is seen here drumming away.
BPA: BPA students stand together at the leadership conference at Delaware Tech. (Left to Right: Trey Haynes, Taylor Scott, Taylor Scott, Nina Burns-Skrobot, Adair Williams, Mr. Shelton)
Homecoming Court: Students celebrated Homecoming festivities and enjoy watching the Blue Raiders football game. Indya Wright and Trey Haynes were crowned Homecoming King and Queen.

Varsity Volleyball Photo: The Volleyball seniors celebrate their final home game together on senior night. (Left to Right: Alexis Durham, Rachel Christopher, Mackenna Kerrick, Ashley Williams, Hannah Pearson, Nina Burns-Skrobot)
